flawed_nl_solution:
Matthew picked 16 + 20 = <<16+20=36>>36 strawberries.
Natalie picked 36/2 = <<36/2=81>>81 strawberries.
All together, they have 16 + 36 + 81 = <<16+36+81=133>>133 strawberries.
They can make 133/7 = <<133/7=19>>19 jars of strawberries.
They earn 19 x $4 = $<<19*4=76>>76 from the strawberries they picked.
#### 76

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18, not 81. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
